website_summaries.verdict: While the "all-new" Paperwhite may seem like an unspectacular upgrade on the surface, it's a clear improvement over the original Paperwhite and arguably the best e-reader currently available.
pros: Amazon has improved on last year's excellent Paperwhite e-reader with a faster processor, more responsive touch screen, and a better integrated light that's brighter and whiter and displays more evenly across the screen
Pages also refresh less frequently (less flashing)
A smattering of new features enhance Amazon's already best-in-class content ecosystem
cons: Device hasn't gotten smaller or significantly lighter since last year, an AC adapter isn't included (just a Micro-USB cable for charging)

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Used to be a great device - until Amazon forced an update that replaced the home screen with an advertisement even for people who paid the extra $20 to not have any Edit: After my review I got a notification on how to change the look back to the original. Should have come with the update. To turn off recommended content: 1. From the Home screen, tap the Menu icon and select Settings. 2. Tap Device Options, and then tap Personalize your Kindle. 3. Tap Advanced Options, and then tap the switch to the right of Home Screen View to turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: Mu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deal
customer_reviews.text: I like reading books on the Paperwhite, the resizable font and excellent, soft and smooth screen make reading glasses unnecessary. It allows for a small library of books to be easily carried and enjoyed anywhere. If you are concerned about privacy, it is easy enough to set up a fake account and tunnel the connection through a router-based VPN client for setup, then just enable Airplane mode. Push books to it through USB and use the free eBook library management software Calibre to manage your collection.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip K. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Prefer original Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the touch screen for turning the pages! It constantly changes my font size when I turn the page. I like the slide rule type measurement on bottom of page to show % of book read and this is not one of the features of paperwhite. Would also like the title of the book to show at top of each page. Except for the paperwhite background feature, I really liked the original Kindle much better.
customer_reviews.author: Marge

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after over four years

Because of the high contrast screen, I don't need glasses to read even with the smaller fonts. I noticed the screen is getting worn where I use my finger to tap to the next page. This morning I looked up the order for it and discovered I bought it in June of 2013. Over four years ago. Thousands of hours of reading and the battery still lasts a couple days. I think I got my money's worth on this.

Plus, this was the first time ever I had contacted the Executive branch of Amazon and they treated me like it was my fault it was broken and again offered zero help.No wonder so many people are choosing to not renew their prime membership.

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life Is Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: I specifically got the paper white for traveling and I didn't want to have to worry about charging it every day. The battery in this lasts an amazingly long time. When I traveled through Europe for a month, I don't even remember charging it once. I probably did once but it will last for weeks of use! The screen is amazing in the sunshine and really looks like you're reading paper instead of a screen which is so much more relaxing for the eyes. The backlight is great for night time or dark rooms. Overall I would highly recommend the paperwhite to others!

customer_reviews.title: The ad serving algorithm is an idiot.
customer_reviews.text: Let’s say, for the sake of argument, you’ve bought a bunch of literary fiction and culture criticism, along with a couple of rock bios, some hardboiled pulp, a little classic sci-fi, and maybe the odd book of poetry or philosophy. Well then unbuckle your belt and belly up to an inexhaustible spread of ads from self-published romance hacks and jackholes who want to be Tom Clancy without being dead yet. Sound good? You may also enjoy a genuine heartwarmer about how you can meet your dog in heaven just as soon as your dad finishes offering you financial advice.

customer_reviews.title: Great For Vet Tech School

All of the images were portrayed vividly and the text was easy to read from a distance without having to squint at the text. There is not color but I did not exactly need color for many of the images found in the books I had to read. The only thing I wanted in the device was a better internet browser with more capability to it.

I may upgrade to a color one in the future, but for now this one does what I want it to do.

I really love it!

customer_reviews.title: Time Limit to this Kindle's Life
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my Paperwhite in April, 2014. Almost exactly two years to the day, my Kindle died. Now, I read a ton. I treat my Kindle like I treat my books- with respect. I didn't drop it or crush it in my bag. Suddenly, the screen had horizontal lines, and 1/2 the screen was completely blank. After a call with Amazon, they could only suggest I use my Kindle app on my iPad and offer a discount on the next. As a Prime customer and heavy Amazon user, I am completely disappointed in the response from Amazon and lack of available options. I am reluctant to purchase another Kindle only to have it die again. Very disappointed Amazon.

customer_reviews.title: I totally dig it.

The screen is as clear as a page in a book, the multiple fonts crisp and black, and the light covers the entire screen evenly no matter the setting. The battery life is impressive even when using the light at near max. Its touchscreen is responsive and intuitive, something I usually have problems with in other devices. If you love to read, get one. I have nearly 500 books on mine with room for plenty more. While I still love paper books, I am now a Kindle lifer.

My only other issue would be that when I try to look through available books, the filters don't let you sort by type of book (i.e.: fiction, non-fiction, biography, young adult, sci-fi, etc.). I only noticed the issue when I tried to use the port for the first time by which time it was out of warranty. The device is in great shape otherwise - not even a scratch because it has been used carefully.

customer_reviews.title: Attractive screen to read with, poorly engineered other features
customer_reviews.text: Nice screen, easy to read, sharp letters. BUT the keyboard needed to set up some features is amazingly clunky and slow-responding (or non-responding). Some options are anything but intuitive (the WiFi browser is a work-in-progress, and really doesn't work). To delete some items seems to require reverting to a full restart (which eliminates other desired items added). It's easy to accidentally add items (free ones, in a sort of one-step way) that one doesn't want. Compared to something like an iPad, it is seriously primitive (but is much cheaper)! Then there's the idea of buying into the "world of Amazon's not-that-cheap ebooks"! Overall, not that inexpensive as an alternative to real books (let alone ones from a library).

customer_reviews.title: I swore to never get an e-reader because I love the feel of reading an actual book but I ...
customer_reviews.text: I swore to never get an e-reader because I love the feel of reading an actual book but I got this as a present and I wish I had gotten it sooner. I absolutely love my kindle. I love that I can carry a bunch of books on a light device, its much cheaper in the long run (if you read alot), since ebooks are alot cheaper than buying hard copy, and it feels like im reading off paper still. The light is easy on the eyes. Also doesnt hurt my wrist when im holding it in any position. Id definitely recommend one of these. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Cha

customer_reviews.title: Everyone Should Have a Kindle!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE my Kindle! It is so easy to take books with you and read them anywhere. Best of all, most of the classic English literature from years past is now in the public domain, and so it is available completely free. I use this at the beach in full, direct sunlight and have no problem reading it. I use it at night in bed, with the lights down low, and the same thing. I was one of those who resisted getting an e-reader, because I thought the feel and smell of a real book was important. Boy, was I wrong!!! Get yourself one of these ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: denverd0n

customer_reviews.title: A disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I'm fairly disappointed with this Kindle iteration. My Kindle Keyboard is very old and I was afraid it would die while we were on vacation, so when I saw this discounted 6th generation Kindle Paperwhite, I got it. However, it's not nearly as easy to use as my old Keyboard. I still haven't gotten a single library book delivered. It won't sync with either my Keyboard or my S7 cell phone. The battery life isn't nearly as good as my Keyboard. The "instructions" included were no help. I've searched through the help topics, but haven't found a single solution. So this one is probably going back, sadly. I'll just stick with my good old Keyboard until it goes kaput.

customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Such an amazing reader
customer_reviews.text: The Kindle Paperwhite is pretty much a perfect device. This one was for my wife who loves it. I purchased the first Paperwhite, and love it. The battery lasts forever, the adjustable brightness of the screen is perfect. I've read some complaints that the illumination isn't perfectly uniform. Although I do understand what people are seeing, I think it's a ridiculous complaint. There is very little disuniformity at the very bottom edge, and you really have to be looking for it. The page turns are quick, the text very sharp and clear. I own the first edition Kindle (wedge shape, toggle buttons, rolling wheel) and loved it. This is better in every way.

customer_reviews.title: I am disgusted and going to another company
customer_reviews.text: This kindle stopped working while on vacation outside of the US. I was stuck without anything to read. I called amazon when I got back and because I did not purchase the extended warranty when I bought the device 19 months ago, I am out of luck. Amazon refused to recognize that I have consistently purchased books for the past 7 years, ordering more that 40 books in 2015 alone. I am disgusted and going to another company. I have been completely devalued as a consumer!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: S Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Love the screen/backlight.
customer_reviews.text: I love my paper white. I hate reading on my phone or other "digital" screens. It is hard on my eyes day or night. This is not at all. I mostly use this for travel now, but got a ton of use out of it when I was nursing. Much less distracting for a hungry baby. I haven't had any issues with it. The only downfall is that you can't actually purchase a book using this or any other "device." You have to be on a computer. So think ahead on that one. Great investment for any reader, even if it only one book every month or so.
customer_reviews.author: j.groo

customer_reviews.title: Did not live 8 months.
customer_reviews.text: This "new" paperwhite did not last 8 months. It has not been dropped or damaged in any way. It lives on my nightstand and is set down easily each night when I go to sleep after reading. My old one, the first one I ever bought, the one with no touch screen and the little keyboard at the bottom? It still works after 5+ years of dropping it, taking it camping, hauling it around in my bookbag, my kids and grandkids using it... Too bad they did not make the new one as sturdy.

customer_reviews.title: Not recognized by 3 different computers, Linux, Windows ...
customer_reviews.text: Not recognized by 3 different computers, Linux, Windows 7 and Mac OS X. This has been reported by numerous people but Amazon only replies with generic BS answers such as "reboot" "uninstall reinstall USB drivers" etc.. The fact that this is seen on 3 very different platforms means that something has changed between this version of Kindle and previous versions. I don't know what game Amazon is playing and I don't care, refund end of story.
customer_reviews.author: Ketil

customer_reviews.title: Screen spontaneously breaks in two months
customer_reviews.text: This product is useless. I have had three or four. The screen spontaneously cracks in 2-4 months. If you fight and talk to a supervisor, you can get a new one during the year after purchased it while you gave a warranty. But when the last one breaks 2 months later after your warranty from the first one ends you have to replace it on your own dime even though you've had the last one two months. They SAY the new one has a better screen.
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: Closest thing to the real thing
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a Father's Day gift from my son. I've been using it for a little over a week and I'm in love. None of the distractions you get from the more upgraded tablets. Instead Amazon really focuses on the book reading experience. With the backlight I really get the sense I'm laying in bed reading a book and not bothering my wife with errant blinding booklights. I highly recommend this for any reader, especially one with a light sleeping spouse. The only update I could see improving this would be a more responsive browser, but I don't use it anyways so it doesn't affect my score at all. 5/5*
customer_reviews.author: Zach Tyo

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  What A Difference!
customer_reviews.text: The Paperwhite is an upgrade from my very old Kindle. I don't remember the proper name, but it has the keyboard embedded in the case and page turning buttons. Having the screen lit all the time is great. I previously had a cover with a pull-out light. It worked, but not nearly as well as the Paperwhite. I've had the e-reader for a month or so now, and still brush the screen by accident or slip my finger off the edge and find myself several chapters ahead of myself. Love the Wikipedia and x-ray features. If you're looking for an upgrade to your existing Kindle, ceck this one out!
